patterns.crud_structure: All schemas follow Base/Create/Update/Response pattern. Base contains shared fields, Create inherits from Base, Update has all fields optional, Response inherits from CamelCaseModel with id and timestamps
patterns.validation_pattern: Use @field_validator with mode='before' to apply sanitize_string to all text fields before Pydantic validation
patterns.base_classes: BaseModel for Base/Create/Update schemas, CamelCaseModel for all Response schemas (converts snake_case to camelCase)
patterns.type_system: UUID for IDs, datetime for timestamps, date for scheduled_date, Type | None for optionals (not Optional[Type]), list[Type] = [] for nested collections
patterns.field_constraints: Import constants from validators (MIN_NAME_LENGTH, MAX_NAME_LENGTH, MAX_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH, MAX_NOTES_LENGTH) and use Field(min_length=..., max_length=...)

existing_implementations.description: Found comprehensive CRUD schema patterns in contact.py and equipment.py, CamelCaseModel base class in validators.py for API serialization, nested response models with list relationships in equipment.py
key_insights: CamelCaseModel uses ConfigDict with from_attributes=True, alias_generator=to_camel, populate_by_name=True
Field validators apply sanitize_string to multiple fields in single decorator
Nested relationships default to empty lists: checklists: list[ChecklistResponse] = []
Modern Python 3.10+ union syntax used throughout: str | None instead of Optional[str]

bilingual_support.description: Inspection schemas require both name (English) and name_he (Hebrew) fields for proper localization
